summary: This mod add the traps in the chests
descriptionHtml:
[center][/center][size=3] With this mod, you think several times before you begin to open the lock. Now there is a possibility that a trap is installed in the closed chest. Something like that you could see in Oscuro's Oblivion Overhaul.[/size]

[color=#e69138][size=4][b][center]How it works[/center][/b][/size]
[/color]
[size=3] [/size]
[size=3]If there is a trap in the chest, then a roll is made to your hacking skill: if the throw is successful - you neutralize the trap, if [/size][size=3]the throw is failed - ... one more throw is made to the evasion skill.[/size]

[spoiler]
[i][color=#f1c232]Calculation formula:[/color][/i] 1d20+ Your Skill/10 > 16 for successful Lockpicking. 
[/spoiler]


[size=4][center][color=#e69138][b]Probability[/b][/color][/center][/size]
[size=3] [/size]
[size=3]The probability of traps for different chests is different. For example, magicians well guard their secrets - you are likely to [/size][size=3]encounter a trap, when looting their chests. Unlike the wizards, the bandits don't  protect their treasures very well - you can, almost, don't worry when hacking their chests.[/size]

[color=#f1c232][size=3][i]Probability on different chests:[/i][/size][/color]
[spoiler]
[size=3]Dwaren         14%[/size]
[size=3]Warlock        50%[/size]
[size=3]Bandit           10%[/size]
[size=3]Draugr           33%[/size]
[size=3]Frostworn     7%[/size]
[size=3]Vampire        33%[/size]
[size=3]Hagraven      20%[/size]
[size=3]SnowElf        20%[/size]
[size=3]Falmer          14%[/size]
[size=3]Common      [/size]25%
[size=3]([/size][size=2]personal, soulcairn, explorer, etc[/size][size=3])   [/size]
[size=3]Noble            50%[/size]
[size=3]             [/size]
[/spoiler]

[size=3] [/size]
[color=#e69138][size=4][center][b]Compatibility[/b][/center][/size][/color]

[size=3]The mod contains two versions: For the original game and for Requiem ( [/size][i][color=#e69138]1.9.x[/color][/i][size=3] ).[/size]
